title: About
text:
ResearchGate
  
  
    
     LinkedIn
  
  
    
     Google Scholar
  
  
    
     Github
  

      
Hello, I’m Carter.
I am an MA candidate in Cognitive Psychology at the University of Waterloo, where I study in Dr. Clara Colombatto’s Vision and Cognition Laboratory.
My current research examines the low-level cues that humans observe in social interactions, which may let them infer things about others (e.g., intentions). Further, I explore how these cues may influence an observers’ cognition (e.g., their attention).
In the past, I have studied the auditory conditions misophonia and hyperacusis and their association with depression and anxiety. I have also worked with virtual reality to explore how modifying stimulus properties (e.g., slot machine size) alters gambling behaviours.
I am passionate about philosophy, cycling, music, and the Toronto Blue Jays.
Please feel free to contact me at: carter.smith@uwaterloo.ca
Check out my research
